TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit InstallEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks InstallEventArgs contains an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> that holds information about the current state of the installation. The <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.BeforeInstall>, <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.AfterInstall>, <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Committing>, <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Committed>, <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.BeforeRollback>, <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.AfterRollback>, <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.BeforeUninstall>, and <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.AfterUninstall> event handlers use this information.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.InstallEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructors and the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.InstallEventArgs.SavedState%2A> property of the InstallEventArgs class.
There are two new events called `BeforeCommit` and `AfterCommit`. The handlers of these events are invoked from the protected methods named `OnBeforeCommit` and `OnAfterCommit` respectively. These events are raised when the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Commit%2A> method is called.
[!code-cpp[InstallEventArgs#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.configuration.i_4_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[InstallEventArgs#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.configuration.i_4_1.vb)] [!code-cs[InstallEventArgs#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.configuration.i_4_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, and leaves the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.InstallEventArgs.SavedState%2A> property empty.

There are two new events called `BeforeCommit` and `AfterCommit`. The handlers of these events are invoked from the protected methods named `OnBeforeCommit` and `OnAfterCommit` respectively. These events are raised when the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Commit%2A> method is called.
